job_title: IT Helpdesk in Eau Claire, WI
pros: I loved working there, great work/home balance and good benefits. My co-workers were wonderful, it felt like family
cons: The company closed in 2013 and I miss it.

job_title: Community Health Worker in Santa Clara, CA
pros: Collaborative. Management respected input. Encouragement initiative.
cons: A lot of walking, inclement weather.

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Eau Claire, WI
pros: CHP's mission/vision/values was the main reason I stayed as long as I did.
cons: Not much business operations leadership; sometimes a bunch of RN's and healthcare workers don't know how to run an efficient business.

job_title: Data Analyst in San Jose, CA
pros: Small tight-knit nonprofit focused on health equity in the Bay Area
cons: Not as technical experience for data analysts

pros: Good work environment, team members, work/life balance, benefits and great patients, very rewarding work.
cons: Understaffed, disorganization and lack of access to specialists

review_title: Open/caring culture, fast growth led to overabundance of upper  management employees & colder atmosphere.
job_title: RN Case Manager in Chippewa Falls, WI
pros: Mission is fantastic.  Provide members (all MA recipients, some dual eligible) w/ quality care using the most cost effective option. Feels good to help peaople & still help the community by saving taxpayer dollars.  Really great culture & wonderful coworkers. New EMR is currently being produced to decrease frustration w/ documentation & increase efficiency.
cons: Upper management is unorganized, which trickles down to Supervisors & teams.  EMR is very cumbersome & time consuming.  Difficult to find forms, guidelines, etc.  Several processes still aren't streamlined & no care guidelines such as Milliman are used.  Difficult to be efficient.  Currently going through major cutbacks/layoffs while at the same time trying toconvince entitled members that they can purchase their own humidifier, tape weights to a fork vs requesting a weighted fork, ask family to bring them to appts or place tub strips, etc.

review_title: Academic Researcher and Specialist Team Project Consultant
pros:
Importance of  strategic team leadership planning, and best practices were evident.
The organization's partnership intent and methodologies increased due to the specialist projects and program team.  I had the opportunity to be a member of this special leadership team. The organization appeared client focused, hence,improving practitioner-client relationship
cons: As an independent contractor, one works as needed.  While the hourly pay rate is somewhat professional, the contracted hours are extremely minimal, and therefore may not suffice ample living income.  Paying taxes is your (employee's) responsibility.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Eau Claire, WI
pros: Able to grow and develop; allowed autonomy. Program Mangers were excellent resources.
cons: Multiple Supervisors who appeared to have the job from a inner office friendship.  I felt these individuals did not know how to support a staff.  Occassional responses to this would be to give a blank look.   Had little knowledge of the skill it takes to lead people and support your workers.

review_title: Good intentions, but poor financial choices
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Eau Claire, WI
pros: Excellent benefits, compassionate and caring employees
cons: Top-heavy management level, original CEO made poor financial decisions and was not a good business leader; should have remained a practitioner rather than a CEO.

review_title: Executive Assistant to Chief Executive Officer
job_title: Executive Assistant to Chief Executive Officer in San Jose, CA
pros: Friendly and helpful co-workers, has a great purpose for their jobs

cons: Can be frustrating working with government agencies who are very bureaucratic
